p: The single cells were then loaded onto a 10× Chromium chip B (10× Genomics, Pleasanton, CA, USA) to generate single-cell gel beads in emulsion (GEMs), which was followed by cDNA amplification. A 3ʹ gene expression library was then constructed using a 10× Genomics Chromium Single Cell system with v3 chemistry (10× Genomics) according to the manufacturer's instructions. Sequencing was performed on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina) by Berry Genomics (Chengdu, China). Output reads (150 bp pair-ended) were yielded through Cell Ranger v3.1.5 using default parameters, including “mkfastq” and “count” pipelines. The detailed information of captured cells for each sample after “count” flow is shown in Figure S1B.
